member.name: F:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.InputPanel.validationErrorMarkers
member.summary: An array that stores controls that will be shown next to input controls whose contents was not considered valid.

remarks.para: This array stores controls that display the graphic next to controls whose values did not fulfill the validation constraints.

The class is not used because the graphic must be specified as an . Graphics in the Two-Layered GUI Toolkit, however, are supplied as PNG streams. The only straightforward way of converting a PNG stream to an is using the method and passing its return value to the static method of the class. That handle has to be freed using a native Windows API function, hence the code would become platform-dependent.

member.name: E:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.InputPanel.ValueValidated
member.summary: Is fired when any of the input values was revalidated.

remarks.para: This event is fired after every update to the validation state of any of the input values. This can occur quite frequently. In order to only get notified when the total validation state in the panel has changed, use the event.

member.name: E:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.InputPanel.ValidationResultChanged
member.summary: Is fired when the validation result of the input values has changed.

remarks.para: This event is fired when the total validation state in the panel has changed. Individual validation result changes of single values are not considered unless they change the overall validation result of all input values.

member.name: P:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.InputPanel.Values
member.summary: Provides access to the current values of the input elements.

value.para: This object provides access to an object that implements the interface. The items of that object are the values of the input fields and can be retrieved and set. Note that, in addition to what is specified for , the setter of the items property may throw an if a value is assigned that is not compatible with the type of the respective input value definition.

member.name: M:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.SimpleDialogs.WinFormsDialogGenerator.CreateLabelWrapper
member.summary: Creates an empty label wrapper.
member.returns: The newly created label wrapper.

remarks.para: The UI-toolkit-specific representation of a dialog element label is wrapped in a widget that will remain in the dialog representation even when the label representation is exchanged. This method creates such a wrapper widget. The wrapper widget needs to be initialized without a label representation, and it needs to be able to hold any type of label representation that may be created for the UI toolkit at hand. If the property of a is not , a label representation will be inserted at a later time.

member.name: M:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.SimpleDialogs.WinFormsDialogGenerator.UpdateLabel(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Replaces a label representation in an existing wrapper widget.
member.param: The label wrapper widget. This must not be .
The new label representation, or if any previous label representation should be removed.

remarks.para: This method places the label representation passed to the parameter in the widget. is guaranteed to be a widget created by and not .
If the label is getting removed, will be . In that case, must be emptied until another possible future call to .

member.name: M:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.WinFormsFactory.HCenterButtonBar.FindLines(System.Int32,TwoLayeredGUI.Graphics.BasicSettings)
member.summary: Sorts the buttons into lines.
member.param: The maximum width the control may occupy.
The basic settings to use.
member.returns: An array of arrays, each of which contains the controls found in one line of buttons.

remarks.para: This method considers the maximum width of the control and sorts all contained controls into one or more lines, wrapping once the maximum width is exceeded. The return value is an array each element of which constitutes a line of controls. The controls found in the line are represented as an array of controls.
The method sets the to accommodate all controls using the specified value.

member.name: M:TwoLayeredGUI.WinForms.Wizard.ChoicePageGuiFactory`1.CreatePage(TwoLayeredGUI.Wizard.IWizardController{`0},System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Creates the graphical user interface for a wizard page.
member.param: An object that allows to control the wizard.
The intended parent element of the page contents.
member.returns: The newly created graphical user interface.

remarks.para: This method generates a graphical representation of the wizard page referenced in . The newly created page GUI is returned from the method.

The argument contains a widget that will serve as the container for the created GUI. This parent element will usually be empty and can be used as a size reference, as it is already scaled correctly for the (initial) size of the wizard page. As such, the parent element does not include any padding or other decorative spacing. The whole client area of the parent element will be used for the page contents. It is allowed, though not required, to add the page GUI as a child to the parent element.

remarks.para: This method generates a graphical representation of the wizard page referenced in . The newly created page GUI is returned from the method.

The argument contains a widget that will serve as the container for the created GUI. This parent element will usually be empty and can be used as a size reference, as it is already scaled correctly for the (initial) size of the wizard page. As such, the parent element does not include any padding or other decorative spacing. The whole client area of the parent element will be used for the page contents. It is allowed, though not required, to add the page GUI as a child to the parent element.
